title: Les Alliés 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Vin de France)
description: Dark fruits—plum, cherry and blackberry—are bold and center stage on the nose, with secondary glimmers of licorice stick and black pepper. The palate offers black fruit-skin flavors that are partnered with medium tannins, resulting in a slightly gripping and astringent close.

title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2013 Coudel Mor Clássico Red (Tejo)
description: Grown on the shelf above the Tagus (Tejo) River, the wine is soft and ripe. It does have tannins that are well integrated into the spicy red fruits and dry core. The wine is rich, and the alcohol is noticeable in the pepper aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Portuga Rosé (Lisboa)
description: This is a soft wine with attractive ripe strawberry fruits and a soft texture. There is balancing acidity giving an edge of freshness to the otherwise gentle fruity texture.

title: Burmester NV Port Jockey Club  (Port)
description: Light in color and lightly textured, this is a toffee and red-fruit flavored wine that is sweet without great definition.

title: Tussock Jumper 2014 Pinot Noir (Vin de France)
description: This easy-drinking Pinot leads with bright aromas of red currant, raspberry and strawberry hull, all leaning slightly sour. The palate is light and tangy, with tart red-berry flavors that finish clean.

title: Viniverde 2015 Alto Lima Rosé (Vinho Verde)
description: This is a fruity, crisp wine with an attractive balance between acidity and sweetness. Ripe strawberries give the fruit flavor while the acidity at the light prickle on the palate add a crisper aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Quara 2011 Viña El Recreo Single Vineyard Tannat (Cafayate)
description: Strained, jumbled aromas of mustard, horseradish and green grass fail in many ways. This feels wide, edgy and tartaric, and thus overall balance is shaky. High acidity creates a sense of sourness, while this Tannat from Salta finishes choppy and acidic.

title: Phantom Bay 2014 Reserve Chardonnay (Vin de France)
description: Oaky notes of buttered toast, dried apple slices and baked peach are upfront in the bouquet of this wine. The palate is similarly rich and round, but with ample acidity to keep it from falling completely flat. Flavors of orange creamsicle and spiced apple linger on the close.

title: Scarlet of Paris 2015 Rosé (Vin de France)
description: This is a ripe and fruity rosé, with forward notes of lychee, rose water, peach gummies and tropical fruit salad. The palate is round and plump in similarly rich fruit flavors, with just enough acidity to keep it from feeling completely flat. Drink up.

title: Alba Roja 2014 White (Mendoza)
description: Tropical fruit aromas are hanging in, while this blend of Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc and Torrontés feels drawn in. Slightly salty melon and apple flavors are showing a hint of oxidation. This finishes a bit dried out.

title: Altocedro 2013 Año Cero Tempranillo (La Consulta)
description: Heavily charred aromas throw a shadow over roasted, stalky red-berry notes. This feels tight, choppy and drawing, with no give to the palate. Roasted, salty plum and berry flavors end with a final round of hard, pounding tannins.

title: D'Arenberg 2015 The Broken Fishplate Sauvignon Blanc (Adelaide Hills)
description: This will likely prove a bit too vegetal for some, as the aromas hint at asparagus. But there's pineapple and honey on the palate and decent weight in the mouth.

title: Château La Greffière 2014  Saint-Véran
description: Warm and round, this has a generous character, while missing some of the attractive crispness of the vintage. It is ready to drink now, soft and fruity.

title: Pedernales 2015 Dry Rosé (Texas)
description: Raspberry Jell-O and strawberries-and-cream aromas appear on the nose. The medium-bodied palate is slightly flabby in feel, with bramble berries meeting a delicate black pepper note.

title: Joseph Drouhin 2014  Macon-Bussières
description: This tight wine lacks fruit. Touches of apple and citrus are lost in the austere texture. No artificial yeasts were used during vinification in stainless steel and large oak barrels.

title: Los Pinos Ranch 2015 Texican Red (Texas High Plains)
description: Soft, approachable and easily structured, this Sangiovese and Montepulciano blend brings forth cherry bubble-gum flavors in a completely gulpable way.

title: Luis Segundo Correas 2013 Valle Las Acequias Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Herbaceous aromas of mint and catnip are heavy on the nose, which also gives off a note of licorice gumdrop. This Malbec is tight and raw in feel, while herbal, spicy plum and currant flavors finish somewhat green.

title: Doña Paula 2014 1100 Red (Uco Valley)
description: One whiff and you can tell this leans towards overripe. Aromas of raisin and baked berry fruits are stewy and cooked. This feels much like it smells: heavy and baked. Flavors of raisin and prune finish similar.

title: Phantom Bay 2013 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Vin de France)
description: Earthy tones of menthol, licorice, black pepper and blackcurrant leaf compliment the blackberry and plum core of this lush yet soft Cab. The palate is plush and round, with light tannins and a sweet-oak finish.

title: Phantom Bay 2013 Reserve Pinot Noir (Vin de France)
description: A pleasant and easy-drinking selection, this leads with softly medicinal aromas of raspberry and red plum alongside a touch of violet. The palate is light and direct, with bright red-fruit flavors that finish short but clean.

title: Pedernales 2014 G-S-M (Texas)
description: This GSM blend is oak-forward, with charred black and red berries meeting dark coffee on the nose and palate. Medium bodied with a mild tannic grip, enjoy alongside a coffee-rubbed rib eye.

title: Quinta de Gomariz 2015 Espadeiro Colheita Seleccionada Rosé (Vinho Verde)
description: Produced from the Espadeiro, a grape widely used in red Vinho Verde, this is a crisp wine with just a touch of candied sweetness. Strawberry fruit is given a blast of acidity. It is ready to drink.

title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2014  Mâcon-Villages
description: Bland and soft, this has light and gently tangy fruit with apple and lime flavors. The aftertaste is fresh. Drink now.

title: Salentein 2015 Killia Collection Torrontés (Mendoza)
description: Powdery, oily aromas are like fruity bath soap. This feels more whole and round than edgy. Slightly salty flavors of melon and ham finish with decent acidity but not much depth or complexity.

title: Llano Estacado 2015 Signature Rosé (Texas)
description: This Rhône-style blend of a rosé is a light, enjoyable sipper of tart red berries, bubble gum and sharp citrus.

title: Viña Alicia 2014 Tiara White (Luján de Cuyo)
description: Muddled, oily aromas are funky for certain. This blend of Riesling, Albariño and Savagnin feels round and melony, but ultimately soft. Floral, pickled melon flavors come in front of a briny, tropical-leaning finish.

title: Tercos 2015 Torrontés (Salta)
description: Flat aromas barely press Torrontés's standard tropical fruit button. Plump, easygoing and soft on the palate, this tastes lightly of passion fruit and lychee, while a mild banana and melon character drives the finish.

title: Vinkara 2014 Narince (Ankara)
description: Aromas of quince and lemon see the stage for flavors of green apple, quince and geranium leaf. Floral notes overpower fruit flavors, and the finish is slightly stiff for a white wine.

title: Early Mountain 2014 Pinot Gris (Virginia)
description: This Pinot Gris is simple, streamlined and to the point. Green apple and lemon driven, the palate is light bodied and crisp with a persistent acidity.

title: Casanel 2013 Carmenère (Middleburg)
description: Blue-raspberry Jell-O tones meld with flecks of green herbal notes on the nose and palate. The medium body is a bit disjointed, showing slightly sharp acidity.
